channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rubio, Hegseth brief lawmakers on boat strikes as frustration grows on Capitol Hill
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth briefed top lawmakers on Wednesday on a series of strikes conducted by the Trump adm...

item.title: NYC's next mayor is a democratic socialist. What does that mean?
item.description: Democratic socialism doesn't have a one-size-fits-all definition. But its proponents emphasize a stronger role for the government over the economy to ...

item.title: Supreme Court justices appear skeptical of Trump's tariff arguments
item.description: At issue is whether the president can bypass Congress and impose tariffs by citing national security.

item.title: A declaration of famine is rare. It's now happened twice in 2025, this time in Sudan
item.description: Famine declarations are relatively rare. But the leading international authority on hunger crises this week declared that regions of war-torn Sudan fa...

item.title: Judge orders White House to use American Sign Language interpreters at briefings
item.description: The National Association of the Deaf is celebrating a legal victory against the White House. A judge ordered ASL for briefings conducted by the press ...

item.title: Democrats hit back and a winning message - four election night takeaways
item.description: It was an encouraging night for the Democratic Party who scored some decisive wins. Here's what we learned.

item.title: Inside Gaza, BBC sees total devastation after two years of war
item.description: With endless rubble and destroyed streets as far as the eye can see, any plans for Gaza's future are a far cry from where it is today, writes Lucy Wil...

item.title: California Republicans sue over new US House map approved by voters
Putin requests proposals for possible resumption of nuclear weapons tests
item.description: President Vladimir Putin says Russia has adhered to a ban on nuclear test explosions after President Trump claimed Moscow is testing nuclear weapons.

item.title: Transportation secretary announces 10% reduction in U.S. air traffic
item.description: The FAA will reduce U.S. air traffic by 10% at 40 U.S. locations starting on Friday due to the government shutdown.

item.title: Hamas hands over another coffin containing remains to Israel
item.description: If the person's identity is confirmed as that of a dead hostage, it will mean six others are still in Gaza.

item.title: At least nine people killed after UPS cargo plane crashes in Kentucky
item.description: Others were injured when the plane exploded during takeoff near Louisville Muhammad Ali International Airport.

item.title: California voters pass Prop 50 to redraw the state's congressional maps, CBS News projects
item.description: California voters have passed Proposition 50, CBS News projects, approving a measure that will redraw the state's congressional districts.

item.title: UPS plane crashes near Louisville airport, killing 11; black boxes found
item.description: The number of fatalities may increase after a UPS plane crashed Tuesday near the Louisville International Airport in Kentucky, Gov. Andy Beshear said.

item.title: An engine fell off a UPS plane before a deadly crash and explosion in Kentucky, the NTSB says
French police launch investigation into Al Fayed sex-trafficking allegations
item.description: The opulent Ritz Hotel, in the heart of Paris, is likely to be a prominent target of the investigation.

item.title: UPS plane crash video offers clues as investigators try to determine cause
item.description: Still images and aerial video footage appear to show the plane's left engine sitting just off the runway in Louisville, Kentucky.

item.title: Democrats dominate as economic woes take a toll on Trumpâ€™s GOP, and other Election Day 2025 takeaways
item.description: Democrats are dominating the first major Election Day since President Donald Trump returned to the White House.
